items.description: River Cole
items.message: This flood alert has been issued as heavy rain and thunderstorms have been forecast for this area today 18/06/2023. There is uncertainty however, over the amount of rainfall expected and the exact location of these thunderstorms and heavy rain. River and surface water flooding may affect these areas. We urge you to remain vigilant and avoid walking and driving through flood water. We are continuing to actively monitor the situation closely and will issue updates, and further flood alerts and warnings if necessary. You can monitor your local weather conditions and river levels on the GOV.UK website.

items.description: Loughborough urban watercourses and local tributaries to the River Soar
items.message: River levels are forecast to rise at the Loughborough river gauge as a result of localised thunderstorms and are expected between 12:00 and 23:59 on 18/06/23.  Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Kingfisher Way, Forest Road and Monarch Way from the Wood Brook, the Grace Dieu Brook, Burleigh Brook, Black Brook, Grammar School Brook, Hermitage Brook, Sileby Brook, Long Whatton Brook, Kingâ€™s Brook and Kingston Brook.   We are closely monitoring the situation.  Please plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses.  Further rain is forecast tomorrow, 19/06/23. This message will be updated by 09:00 tomorrow morning, 19/06/23, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Leen, Day Brook and Tottle Brook in Nottinghamshire

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Leen, Day Brook, Tottle Brook

items.message:
River levels are rising at the Day Brook river gauge as a result of localised thunderstorms.  Consequently, flooding of property/roads and farmland is expected/possible to begin between HH:MM and 18:00 and 23:59 on 18/06/23.  Areas most at risk are low-lying recreational areas and roads including High School playing fields on Valley Road and other low lying land and recreational areas, low lying land and roads around the Tottle Brook.   
We expect river levels to remain high until 09:00 on 19/06/23.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are patrolling watercourses in the area.  
Please plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses.  
This message will be updated by 08:00 in the morning, 19/06/23, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Middlesbrough Becks
items.message:
River levels will rise rapidly on the Middlesbrough Becks due to heavy rainfall and thunderstorms that are forecast to move north-eastwards across the area from early evening on Sunday, 18/06/2023. Some parts of the area could see a large amount of rainfall in a short space of time leading to the risk of flash flooding. 
Flooding is possible to affect locations near the Middlesbrough Becks, with low lying land expected to be most affected, particularly around riverside footpaths and low-lying land and roads.
The rain will clear the area in the early hours of Monday morning, 19/06/2023.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and are checking rivers for blockages in the area.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 19/06/2023, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Wirral catchment with Heswall, Ellesmere Port, Bebington, Hoylake and Wallasey

floodArea.county: Cheshire West and Chester, Halton, Liverpool, Sefton, Wirral

items.message: This message has been issued pre-emptively ahead of localised thunderstorms expected between 17:00 and 22:00 on 18/06/23 and with further rainfall expected Monday afternoon. Small, flashier rivers and streams may respond to heavy rainfall. Given the unpredictable nature of thunderstorms, there is low confidence in the locations and impacts of rainfall at this point. Areas most at risk are low lying agricultural land, roads and footpaths close to small rivers and streams. Water levels could rise rapidly and potentially generate deep, fast flows. We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are monitoring watercourses in the area. Please plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast. This message will be updated as the situation changes. Follow @envagencyNW on Twitter for information for your area.

items.description: River Rye catchment
items.message:
Areas across the River Rye and neighbouring watercourses may be affected by thunderstorms and heavy showers overnight, Sunday 18th and into Monday 19th of June.

It is not possible to predict the precise location, therefore, we are taking the precautionary measure by issuing this flood alert, as watercourses could react very quickly if the thunderstorms occur in this area, as thereâ€™s a risk of localised surface water flooding and flooding from smaller rivers affecting roads, homes and businesses. 

Our staff are monitoring the situation and our field teams are working with partners to ensure that defences and trash screens are clear of obstructions.

At the moment we do not expect to issue any Flood Warnings, but that situation could change rapidly with the weather, and we may not have time to issue any flood warnings before the onset of any flooding. Please stay aware of your surroundings and do not put yourself at risk. Be prepared to act on your flood plan.

This message will be updated by 09:00 on 19/06/23, or as the situation changes.

River Spen and Batley Beck catchments

floodArea.riverOrSea: Batley Beck, Chickenley Beck, Lands Beck, River Spen, Blacup Beck

items.message: This flood alert has been issued due to heavy showers and thunderstorms affecting areas across the River Spen and Batley Beck catchments on Sunday 18th June and into the early morning, Monday 19th June. River levels remain high and there are further heavy showers forecast overnight so this flood alert will remain in force but will likely be removed tomorrow morning, Monday 19th June. Our staff are monitoring the situation and our field teams are working with partners to ensure that defences and trash screens are clear of obstructions. For weather forecasts for your area please see the Met Office www.metoffice.gov.uk.  Please stay aware of your surroundings and do not put yourself at risk.  This message will be updated by 08:30 on 19/06/23, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Calder, Walsden Water, Hebden Water

items.description: Pimlico Brook at Clitheroe, along Warwick Drive and Dorset Drive
items.message:
River levels are rising rapidly on the Pimlico Brook due to heavy rainfall.
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Pimlico Brook.
Flooding is expected at properties on Longsight Avenue, Chatburn Road near to the cricket ground, Warwick Drive and Dorset Drive from 09:00 PM on 18/06/2023.
Further rainfall is forecast overnight.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and are checking rivers for blockages in the area.
Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. Consider putting your flood plan into action. You should avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
This message will be updated by 08:00 AM on 19/06/2023, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Batley Beck at Bradford Road through central Batley

Car Brook at Darnall
Ings Beck and Oakenshaw Beck

floodArea.riverOrSea: Ings Beck, Alverthorpe Beck, Balne Beck, Oakenshaw Beck

items.message: This flood alert has been issued due to heavy showers and thunderstorms affecting areas across Ings and Oakenshaw Beck on Sunday 18th June and into early morning, Monday 19th June.  The river levels are now starting to recede and it is likely that this alert will be removed on Monday morning. There are further heavy showers forecast overnight but these should clear away by the early hours of Monday morning. Our staff are monitoring the situation and our field teams are working with partners to ensure that defences and trash screens are clear of obstructions.  For weather forecasts for your area please see the Met Office www.metoffice.gov.uk.  Please stay aware of your surroundings and do not put yourself at risk.  This message will be updated by 08:30 on 19/06/23, or as the situation changes.

Hunsworth Beck at Oakenshaw
items.message: River levels have risen rapidly as a result of localised thunderstorms. Consequently, flooding is possible on Sunday 18th June overnight into Monday morning. Areas most at risk include properties along Dealburn Road, Walker Road, Cleckheaton Road, New Brighton Road and at Lower Woodlands. There may be further heavy bursts of rain that will move away in the early hours of Monday 19th June. Our incident response staff are closely monitoring the situation and the forecast and are checking defences and trash screens. Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and prepare to put your flood plan into action. This message will be updated by 08:30 on 19/06/23, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Cole at Coleshill
items.message: River levels have risen at the Swans Barn river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall. Consequently, flooding of property, roads and farmland is possible later this morning. Flooding is affecting properties around Station Road. Further light rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours. We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast. Please avoid contact with flood water and call 999 if in immediate danger. This message will be updated by 17:00 on 19/06/23, or as the situation changes.
